alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:21PM EST until January 11 at 1:27AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by the earlier excessive rainfall and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Connecticut, including the following counties, Hartford and Tolland. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of smaller rivers, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 PM EST, Doppler radar has indicated that the heavy rain has come to an end. However...runoff from the earlier heavy rain and snowmelt will continue to result in flooding of small rivers and streams. Many gages continue to indicate smaller rivers and streams still rising. - This includes the following streams and drainages... The Quinnipiac River at Southington which was still rising and very close to major flooding! The North Branch of the Park River remains above flood stage as well. Additional small rivers and streams will also experience flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Manchester, East Hartford, Enfield, Southington, Glastonbury, Newington, Vernon, Windsor, Wethersfield, South Windsor, Farmington, Simsbury, Bloomfield, Berlin, Rocky Hill and Avon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
